ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'

about.summary: Contains a set of tools for constructing and coercing into and from the "mdate" class. This date class implements ISO 8601-2:2019(E) and allows regular dates to be annotated to express unspecified date components, approximate or uncertain date components, date ranges, and sets of dates. This is useful for describing and analysing temporal information, whether historical or recent, where date precision may vary.

Contains a set of tools for constructing and coercing into and from the "mdate" class. This date class implements ISO 8601-2:2019(E) and allows regular dates to be annotated to express unspecified date components, approximate or uncertain date components, date ranges, and sets of dates. This is useful for describing and analysing temporal information, whether historical or recent, where date precision may vary.

name: r-messydates
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.5.4" %}

{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-messydates
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/messydates_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/messydates/messydates_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: f128b4097edac3d42e98dfd7c5b5be0f389c9cc1044a50a8e9fc50a7cf4ffac4

build:
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]

  host:
    - r-base
    - r-dplyr
    - r-lubridate
    - r-purrr
    - r-stringr
    - r-tibble

  run:
    - r-base
    - r-dplyr
    - r-lubridate
    - r-purrr
    - r-stringr
    - r-tibble

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('messydates')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('messydates')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=messydates
  license: MIT
  summary: Contains a set of tools for constructing and coercing into and from the "mdate" class. This date class implements ISO 8601-2:2019(E) and allows regular dates to be annotated to express unspecified date components, approximate or uncertain date components, date ranges, and sets of dates. This is useful for describing
    and analysing temporal information, whether historical or recent, where date precision may vary.
  license_family: MIT
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/MIT'
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - thewchan

# The original CRAN metadata for this package was:

# Package: messydates
# Title: A Flexible Class for Messy Dates
# Description: Contains a set of tools for constructing and coercing into and from the "mdate" class. This date class implements ISO 8601-2:2019(E) and allows regular dates to be annotated to express unspecified date components, approximate or uncertain date components, date ranges, and sets of dates. This is useful for describing and analysing temporal information, whether historical or recent, where date precision may vary.
